DOC.brief_summary: One of the major problems of systemic sclerosis (SSc) patients is suggested to be articular involvement. Mostly involved joints in SSc were reported as wrist, carpometacarpal-interphalangeal, foot, knee, hip and shoulder however there have been little knowledge on sacroiliac joint. Here the investigators plan a study on the involvement of this joint in SSc.
DOC.criteria: Patients diagnosed as systemic sclerosis and rheumatoid arthritis and healthy volunteers Not giving informed consent
